definitions.definition: To move downwards , to fall , to drop .
examples: The dollar has declined rapidly since 2001.

definitions.definition: To bend downward; to bring down; to depress; to cause to bend, or fall.
To cause to decrease or diminish.
To turn or bend aside; to deviate; to stray; to withdraw.
To choose not to do something; refuse , forbear , refrain .
examples: On reflection I think I will decline your generous offer.

definitions.definition: To inflect for case , number , gender , and the like.
definitions.label_groups: transitive , grammar , usually of substantives, adjectives and pronouns

definitions.definition: To recite all the different declined forms of (a word): to recite its declension .
To run through from first to last; to recite in order as though declining a noun.
To reject a penalty against the opposing team, usually because the result of accepting it would benefit the non-penalized team less than the preceding play.
examples: The team chose to decline the fifteen-yard penalty because their receiver had caught the ball for a thirty-yard gain.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To move downwards , to fall , to drop .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To become weaker or worse .
( transitive ) To bend downward; to bring down; to depress; to cause to bend, or fall.
( transitive ) To cause to decrease or diminish.
To turn or bend aside; to deviate; to stray; to withdraw.
( transitive ) To choose not to do something; refuse , forbear , refrain .
( transitive , grammar , usually of substantives, adjectives and pronouns ) To inflect for case , number , gender , and the like.
( transitive , grammar ) To recite all the different declined forms of (a word): to recite its declension .
( by extension ) To run through from first to last; to recite in order as though declining a noun.
( American football , Canadian football ) To reject a penalty against the opposing team, usually because the result of accepting it would benefit the non-penalized team less than the preceding play.
